creator: curvewrecker@cox.net
text:
Sorry, I hit enter before I filled this out.
I have this in the build file:
<property name="hostname" value="127.0.0.1"/>

Later in one of the tasks I have a filter:
<filter token="HOST" value="${hostname}" />
<echo>Setting host to: ${hostname}</echo>

Now, if I run ANT using a flag of -Dhostname="localhost", I get an [echo] of:
Setting host to: localhost

However, the filter ignores the supplied change and still subs 127.0.0.1 in 
for @hostname@ in my files.

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
Can you do a clean build and try again. I suspect that what is happening is that
<copy> thinks that the file hasnt changed, as it only looks at the timestamps of
the source and destination.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
properties are not expanded in files loaded as filter files, but they are expanded
when used as attributes - the <filter> element doesn't ever see the unexpanded
string.
